description.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities,which contributes to Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Maternal And Newborn Health, Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition And Hiv, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: PCR 1: Mother and child survival, growth and development PCR 3: Adolescent participation and empowerment

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Capacity building for nutrition preparedness and response
Care for children with severe acute malnutrition
Community and home based maternal and newborn care
HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Immunization supply chain, including cold chain
Technical assistance - Treatment of severe acute malnutrition

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in India (Adolescent Development and Participation)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities

description.narrative: Facility based care for children with Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM) positioned as core intervention of Ministry of Health and Family Welfare and scaled-up. Process initiated for scale-up of interventions for community based management of children with SAM as comprehensive programme; with eight states having planned or initiated community-based programmes. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2018

title.narrative: Proportion of states with an comprehensive strategy to scale up services to provide timely and quality care for children with severe acute malnutrition

baseline.value: 7 of 13 states the defaulter rate is <15%

title.narrative: Health facilities that provide SAM treatment services

Proportion of states with a focused strategy and budget to provide care and support for children with severe acute malnutrition in the most deprived communities (high Scheduled Castes /Scheduled Tribes population)

baseline.value: > 90% districts with high ST population have at least one functional NRC

target.value: 2016:100% districts with high ST population have at least one functional NRC
